channel.title: Client Crash
channel.description:
How do i fix this

item.title: Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Nitronic Nitronic
item.description:
@Nitronic wrote:

ive reinstalled JDK and JRE how do i scan for JDH’s?

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Nexus1 Nexus_
item.description:
@Nexus1 wrote:

A normal scan should work. If nothing comes up, then the JDH’s aren’t a problem for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Nitronic Nitronic
item.description:
@Nitronic wrote:

how do i find these

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Nexus1 Nexus_
item.description:
@Nexus1 wrote:

Java deleting gals, little things you can pick up from sources that have one in it. They basically delete a little part of someones Java withou them knowing it. That’s the main cause of problems like these.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Nexus1 Nexus_
item.description:
@Nexus1 wrote:

[quote=“Ksu, post:3, topic:333123”]You’re running Windows 7.

Replace your run.bat with this one:

@echo off TITLE Run "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m client 0 0 highmem members 0 pause[/quote]

that ^^^ and you might want to reinstall java, becouse from the looks of it some of your java files might be corrupted or not fully installed correctly. Also, I’d check for any JDH’s. If you find any, delete them. They’re probobly causing the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Ksu Ksu
item.description:
@Ksu wrote:

You’re running Windows 7.

Replace your run.bat with this one:

@echo off TITLE Run "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m client 0 0 highmem members 0 pause

Read full topic

item.title: Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Hotmailer Hotmailer
item.description:
@Hotmailer wrote:

Holy shit.
I don’t know.

Read full topic
